item.title: Exhale Prediction (Work in Progress)
item.description: Trying to predict an exhale image from inhale using VAE latents.

item.title: FibLDM (Work in Progress)
item.description: I am fine-tuning Stable Diffusion using LoRA and DreamBooth to generate axial CT scans of lungs with fibrosis.

item.title: BIO 394 Talk
item.description:
Researched and presented on sequence alignment algorithms (Smith-Waterman) and modern tools like DIAMOND and DeepClust, including k-mer hashing and vertex cover applications. Empty slides were for writing on chalkboard.

You can also view the slides directly .

item.title: Pan-Cancer Classification Using Multi-Omic Synergy
item.description:
This project investigates the hypothesis that a machine learning model’s ability to classify cancer types can be significantly improved by integrating multi-omic data.

Cancer is a disease driven by genomic changes that manifest as functional changes in the transcriptome. While studies often use one data type, such as gene expression (RNA-seq), this project tests whether a model given both the structural blueprint (Copy Number Variation or CNV) and the functional activity (RNA-seq) will build a more robust and synergistic model, achieving a new level of predictive accuracy.

You can also view the standalone notebook .

item.title: BIO 377 Final Presentation
item.description:
Researched and presented on the best approach to aligning tag-seq data when no or a poor species-specific reference transcriptome is available.

You can also view the slides directly .
